parameters.content: ## Auto‚ÄëGenerate Release Notes for Any GitHub Repo ‚Üí Slack

#üöÄ GitHub Automated Release Workflow (n8n)

This workflow auto-generates release notes from merged pull requests and creates a draft GitHub release, notifying via Slack. Below are the descriptions for each node involved:

‚∏ª

üß© 1. GitHub Release Input Form
	‚Ä¢	Purpose: Collects user input for:
	‚Ä¢	owner: GitHub username/org
	‚Ä¢	repo: Repository name
	‚Ä¢	branch: Target base branch

‚∏ª

‚öôÔ∏è 2. Config
	‚Ä¢	Purpose:
	‚Ä¢	Extracts user input from the form node.
	‚Ä¢	Defines the label grouping map to classify PRs under sections like feature, bug, performance, etc.

‚∏ª

üîñ 3. Get Latest Git Tag
	‚Ä¢	Purpose: Fetches the most recent semantic Git tag from the selected repository.
	‚Ä¢	Why: Used to determine what PRs were merged after the last release.

‚∏ª

üïí 4. Get Commit Date of Latest Tag
	‚Ä¢	Purpose: Retrieves the commit timestamp for the latest tag.
	‚Ä¢	Why: This timestamp is used to filter only the PRs merged after the last release.

‚∏ª

üì• 5. Fetch All Merged PRs Since Last Tag
	‚Ä¢	Purpose: Queries GitHub‚Äôs Search API for pull requests:
	‚Ä¢	That are merged.
	‚Ä¢	Merged after the latest tag‚Äôs commit date.
	‚Ä¢	On the selected base branch.
	‚Ä¢	Why: Ensures only new, relevant PRs are included in the release.

‚∏ª

üß† 6. Adjusted: Group PRs & Generate Release Note
	‚Ä¢	Purpose:
	‚Ä¢	Groups the filtered PRs by label (using Config map).
	‚Ä¢	Formats them into a clean Markdown release note.
	‚Ä¢	Adds a ‚úÖ QA Checklist section at the end.

‚∏ª

ü™Ñ 7. GitHub Pre Release
	‚Ä¢	Purpose:
	‚Ä¢	Creates a draft GitHub release.
	‚Ä¢	Uses the latest tag and generated notes.
	‚Ä¢	Sets:
	‚Ä¢	"draft": true
	‚Ä¢	"prerelease": false

‚∏ª

üí¨ 8. Send Message to Slack
	‚Ä¢	Purpose: Posts the release summary to a designated Slack channel.
	‚Ä¢	Includes: Tag name, categorized release notes, and optionally a link to the GitHub release.
